meanings.definition: To move or walk in a leisurely or relaxed manner.
meanings.sent1: She was wauchting along the path, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: The couple wauchted through the park, hand in hand.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be wauchting around the garden, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: Time wauchted by like a slow river, peaceful and unhurried.
meanings.sent5: His wauchting pace was calming, like a gentle breeze on a warm day.

meanings.definition: The act of strolling or wandering aimlessly.
meanings.sent1: His wauchting through the streets often led him to unexpected discoveries.
meanings.sent2: The wauchting of the children in the park brought smiles to onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The wauchting of the clouds in the sky seemed to mimic his aimless wandering.
meanings.sent4: Her mind's wauchting through memories was like flipping through an old photo album.
meanings.sent5: The wauchting of the river downstream was a peaceful sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: Taking a wauchting in the garden was her favorite way to relax.
meanings.sent2: The wauchting along the beach at sunset was a magical experience.
meanings.sent3: The wauchting of the leaves in the breeze created a soothing rustling sound.
meanings.sent4: His wauchting through life was like a slow dance, graceful and deliberate.
meanings.sent5: The wauchting of the old man had a certain elegance to it, like a ballet on the sidewalk.
